intro: Corispermum anatolicum, commonly known as Anatolian corispermum, is a flowering plant native to regions of Turkey and the Eastern Mediterranean. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in saline soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique adaptations and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
